intro: Eleutherococcus nodiflorus, commonly known as the nodiflorous arrowwood, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red berries that are an important food source for wildlife. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
